You're welcome :) but we had a power outage here last night and my ISP was offline for sometime, and, I'm messing with my security a bit (got some erm, new stuff) so I'll blink in and out for the next few days.
Last but not least, even after I'm up to full throttle later this week, it might take awhile before you manage to snag those of us with high speed.
Remember, the first rule in file sharing is patience.
Even if you only hook 1 server at dialup speed you'd get it by june 1st.
As long as you're getting 10+ on a single file, I'd say you're doing OK over dialup, it depends on how many seeders there are, as opposed to how many want it, we can't feed 50,000 people at once, lol.
(yeah I know it's not that high, but you get the idea of divided bandwidth I assume?)
Cheers, be patient, it's here till you get it, I ain't going nowhere... :)

Look guys, this torrent is over 21GB... that's HUGE! It is going to take a while to DL and there is nothing I can do anymore to hep you. It took me the whole summer to get this whole thing so if you get it in 3 days, feel lucky.

EVERY time I open the torrent there is over 300 people leaching, so even if there is NO seed at all you should be able to get decent speeds if you connect to enough people.

I have been opening it every week or so to make sure that it is still being shared in its entirety and that there isn't like 98% being shared or something like that. (since that is what happened to me last summer when I was trying to get it!)

So bottom line... be patient and you WILL get this. It may take a while to DL though even if you have the world's fastest connection.

This torrent has been around for three years and only one person managed to notice the sync issue. Since season 7 is my favorite season i noticed the issue right away, here is a quick and permanent sync fix that doesn't involve you having to deal with the issue every single time you play the file.

1. Download VirtualDub
2. Open your file in VirtualDub. 
3. Go to Audio>Interleaving and experiment with the 'Audio Skew Correction' setting (1000 ms = 1 second). Make sure both Video and Audio are set to 'Direct Stream Copy' 
4. Finally go to File>Save As AVI. Play your new file and check the sync. If it's still not right just repeat the process until it's OK, though it should have worked.

Side note: how is it that seasons 1-3 are not DVDRips what a rip, i mean they were released way back in 04 and 05. and yet no matter where you look finding DVDRips of the first three season is damn near impossible.
